The '''King's House''' was a building where the [[Kings of Gondor]] lived.

== History ==
While the south kingdom of [[Gondor]] was co-ruled by [[Isildur]] and [[Anárion]], the house of Isildur was in [[Minas Ithil]] and the house of Anárion was in [[Minas Anor]], but their thrones were side by side in the [[Great Hall of Osgiliath]] in the city of [[Osgiliath]], the capital of Gondor.<ref>{{S|Rings}}</ref> After the death of Anárion in the [[Siege of Barad-dûr|siege]] of [[Barad-dûr]] in {{SA|3440}}, the co-ruling of the kingdom of Gondor was abandoned and Isildur committed the rule of Gondor to Anárion's son, [[Meneldil]], when he left Gondor in {{TA|2}}<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 2, p. 1085</ref> to travel to the north kingdom of [[Arnor]] to assume the high kingship over Arnor and Gondor, because his father [[Elendil]] had died in combat with [[Sauron]] in {{SA|3441}}.<ref>{{App|SA}}, entry for the year 3441, p. 1084</ref><ref>{{App|Gondor}}, entry for King Ondoher, p. 1049</ref> During the earlier history of [[Gondor]], the King's House was located in [[Osgiliath]].<ref name=Tarondor>{{App|Gondor}}, entries for King Telemnar and King Tarondor, p. 1048</ref> After King [[Ostoher]] rebuilt Minas Anor in {{TA|420}}<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 420, p. 1085</ref> the Kings of Gondor lived in Minas Anor in the summer instead of in Osgiliath.<ref>{{App|Gondor}}, entry for King Ostoher, p. 1044</ref>

Queen [[Berúthiel]], the wife of King [[Tarannon Falastur|Tarannon]], was said to prefer living in the King's House in Osgiliath to the house that her husband had built by the [[Ethir Anduin]] south of [[Pelargir]]. While living in the King's House, she kept her chambers bare and had the gardens filled with tormented sculptures.<ref>{{UT|Istari}}, Note 7</ref>

In {{TA|1636}} a large number of people, especially in Osgiliath, including King [[Telemnar]] and all his children, died in the [[Great Plague]] that had come from the East. Four years later, in {{TA|1640}}<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 1640, p. 1086</ref> his nephew, King [[Tarondor]], permanently moved the residence of the King to the King's House in Minas Anor, because Osgiliath had become partly uninhabited and began to fall into ruin.<ref name=Tarondor/> The King's House was located on the west side of the [[Citadel of Gondor|Citadel]] of Minas Anor behind the [[Tower of Ecthelion|White Tower]] and the [[Tower Hall|Hall of the Kings]], which stood at the centre of the Citadel.<ref name=SD>{{SD|Partings}}, p. 67</ref> it is possible that the King's House used to be the former summer residence of the kings in Minas Arnor.

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
Although the location of the King's House in Minas Tirith is not mentioned in the narrative of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', it is shown on a small plan of the Citadel that [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] drew on a page with a rough draft for the passage about Merethrond, the [[Great Hall of Feasts]], in the chapter [[Many Partings]].<ref name=SD/>
